definition[0]: the explosion at the beginning of time, which most scientists believe caused the universe to exist
definition[1]: the name given to the changes in the system and rules of the London stock exchange which came into effect on December 27th 1986
example[1]: By October 1987, a year after Big Bang, the inflated City salaries were slipping.
definition[2]: a popular name for the major changes that happened on the London STOCK EXCHANGE in 1986, which ended the differences between JOBBERs and BROKERs, and the system of fixed COMMISSIONs on buying and selling shares
definition[3]: a name for similar events in other financial centres
example[2]: The Big Bang opened the protected world of French broking to powerful and well-capitalized banks.
